Name: RawNet2 for spoofing
Title: Implement RawNet2 to use it in audio anti-spoofing
Experiment: RawNet2 is one of the most popular CNN-based audio recognition models. Audio anti-spoofing is one of the main challenges in audio domain. Successfully impelmenting the model could potentially lead to broader search dimension of models in anti-spoofing domain

Name: Parameterise analytic filterbanks in RawNet2
Title: Implement parameterised analytic filterbanks and preemphasis modules, which is a extension of SincConv, to RawNet2
Experiment: Parameterised Analytic Filterbank is used to process raw waveform into time-frequency representation. Successfully implementing the module could potentially lead to broader search dimension of models in anti-spoofing domain. It can be enabled by configuring preemp option in RawNet2 module

Name: depthwise_separable_convolutions_in_rawnet2
Title: Integrating Depthwise Separable Convolutions into RawNet2 for Audio Anti-Spoofing
Experiment: Modify the RawNet2 architecture to replace standard convolutions with depthwise separable convolutions in the residual blocks. Implement a new class for depthwise separable convolutions and integrate it into the existing residual block structure. Train the modified model on the same datasets and evaluate its performance in terms of accuracy, EER (Equal Error Rate), and computational efficiency. Compare the results with the original RawNet2 model to assess the impact of the new architecture.
